name: 06-OSA-On-Shelf-Availability-Time-Series-Modeling-Prediction
parameters: --var skUsEDA1=6,52,57,64,76 --var storeIdEDA1='Fresh Valley Market','Metro Mart','Sunrise Grocers','Evergreen Foods','Quality Basket' --var yearsEDA1=2019,2020,2021 --var exploreData=false --var skUsEDA2=6,52,57,64,76 --var storeIdEDA2=63,98,164,171,178 --var yearsEDA2=2019,2020,2021 --var skUs_Forecasting='Chairs','Sofa','Tables','Mirrors','Fan' --var storeId_Forecasting='Fresh Valley Market','Metro Mart','Sunrise Grocers','Evergreen Foods','Quality Basket' --var years_Forecasting=2019,2020,2021 --var forecast=true

nodes.name: Read CSV

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName

fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe

fields.name: quote

fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape

nodes.name: ARIMA
nodes.description: AutoARIMA

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: y
fields.title: Y
fields.description: The time-series to which to fit the ARIMA estimator

fields.name: default_model
fields.title: Default Model
fields.description: Ignore all the parameters and build a default model

fields.name: exogenous
fields.title: Exogenous Columns
fields.description: An optional 2-d array of exogenous variables. If provided, these variables are used as additional features in the regression operation. This should not include a constant or trend.

fields.name: start_p
fields.title: start_p
fields.description: The starting value of p, the order (or number of time lags) of the auto-regressive (“AR”) model. Must be a positive integer.

fields.name: d
fields.title: d
fields.description: The order of first-differencing. If None (by default), the value will automatically be selected based on the results of the test.

fields.name: start_q
fields.title: start_q
fields.description: The starting value of q, the order of the moving-average (“MA”) model. Must be a positive integer.

fields.name: max_p
fields.title: max_p
fields.description: The maximum value of p, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than or equal to start_p.

fields.name: max_d
fields.title: max_d
fields.description: The maximum value of d, or the maximum number of non-seasonal differences. Must be a positive integer greater than or equal to d.

fields.name: max_q
fields.title: max_q
fields.description: The maximum value of q, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_q.

fields.name: start_P_seasonal
fields.title: start_P_seasonal
fields.description: The starting value of P, the order of the auto-regressive portion of the seasonal model.

fields.name: D_seasonal
fields.title: D_seasonal
fields.description: The order of the seasonal differencing. If None (by default, the value will automatically be selected based on the results of the seasonal_test. Must be a positive integer or None.

fields.name: start_Q_seasonal
fields.title: start_Q_seasonal
fields.description: The starting value of Q, the order of the moving-average portion of the seasonal model.

fields.name: max_P_seasonal
fields.title: max_P_seasonal
fields.description: The maximum value of P, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_P.

fields.name: max_D_seasonal
fields.title: max_D_seasonal
fields.description: The maximum value of D. Must be a positive integer greater than D.

fields.name: max_Q_seasonal
fields.title: max_Q_seasonal
fields.description: The maximum value of Q, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_Q.

fields.name: max_order
fields.title: max_order
fields.description: If the sum of p and q is >= max_order, a model will not be fit with those parameters, but will progress to the next combination. Default is 5. If max_order is None, it means there are no constraints on maximum order.

fields.name: m
fields.title: m
fields.description: The period for seasonal differencing, m refers to the number of periods in each season.

fields.name: seasonal
fields.title: Seasonal
fields.description: Whether to fit a seasonal ARIMA. Default is True

fields.name: stationary
fields.title: Stationary
fields.description: Whether the time-series is stationary and d should be set to zero.

fields.name: information_criterion
fields.title: Information Criterion
fields.description: The information criterion used to select the best ARIMA model.

fields.name: alpha
fields.title: Alpha
fields.description: Level of the test for testing significance.

fields.name: test
fields.title: Test
fields.description: Type of unit root test to use in order to detect stationarity if stationary is False and d is None. Default is kpss (Kwiatkowski–Phillips–Schmidt–Shin).

fields.name: seasonal_test
fields.title: Seasonal Test
fields.description: This determines which seasonal unit root test is used if seasonal is True and D is None. Default is OCSB.

fields.name: stepwise
fields.title: Stepwise
fields.description: Whether to use the stepwise algorithm to identify the optimal model parameters.

fields.name: trend
fields.title: Trend
fields.description: The trend parameter. If with_intercept is True, trend will be used. If with_intercept is False, the trend will be set to a no- intercept value..

fields.name: method
fields.title: Method
fields.description: The method determines which solver from scipy.optimize is used.

fields.name: maxiter
fields.title: Maxiter
fields.description: The maximum number of function evaluations. Default is 50.

fields.name: trace
fields.title: Trace
fields.description: Whether to print status on the fits.

fields.name: random
fields.title: Random
fields.description: Similar to grid searches, auto_arima provides the capability to perform a “random search” over a hyper-parameter space. If random is True, rather than perform an exhaustive search or stepwise search, only n_fits ARIMA models will be fit (stepwise must be False for this option to do anything).

fields.name: random_state
fields.title: Random State
fields.description: The PRNG for when random=True. Ensures replicable testing and results.

fields.name: n_fits
fields.title: N Fits
fields.description: If random is True and a “random search” is going to be performed, n_iter is the number of ARIMA models to be fit.

fields.name: out_of_sample_size
fields.title: Out of Sample Size
fields.description: The ARIMA class can fit only a portion of the data if specified, in order to retain an “out of bag” sample score. This is the number of examples from the tail of the time series to hold out and use as validation examples. The model will not be fit on these samples, but the observations will be added into the model’s endog and exog arrays so that future forecast values originate from the end of the endogenous vector

fields.name: scoring
fields.title: Scoring
fields.description: The metric to use for scoring the out-of-sample data. One of (mse, mae)

fields.name: with_intercept
fields.title: With Intercept
fields.description: Whether to include an intercept term. Default is “auto” which behaves like True until a point in the search where the sum of differencing terms will explicitly set it to True or False.

nodes.name: Join Using SQL
nodes.description: This node registers the incoming DataFrames as temporary tables and executes the SQL provided

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT *, Nvl((Predicted_Total_Sales_Units - total_sales_units), 0) AS units_difference
FROM
(
  SELECT a.*, Nvl(b.Predicted_Sales, 0) AS Predicted_Total_Sales_Units
  FROM tempTable1 a LEFT JOIN tempTable2 b ON a.trans_date = b.New_Date
  )
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT *,
CASE 
        WHEN units_difference > LAG(units_difference, 1) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date) AND 
             LAG(units_difference, 1) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date) > LAG(units_difference, 2) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date) /* AND 
             LAG(units_difference, 2) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date) > LAG(units_difference, 3) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date) */
             THEN 1
        ELSE 0 
END AS osa_alert_inc_deviation
FROM fire_temp_table
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Output Column Types
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT *,
CASE 
        WHEN deviation > 0.20  AND osa_alert_inc_deviation = 1 THEN 1
        ELSE 0
END AS off_sales_alert
FROM
(
  SELECT *,
  Nvl((predictions_4day_avg - sales_4day_avg) / (predictions_4day_avg+1), 0) AS deviation
  FROM
  (
    SELECT *,
    AVG(total_sales_units) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date ROWS BETWEEN 3 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS sales_4day_avg,
    AVG(Predicted_Total_Sales_Units) OVER(PARTITION BY store_id, sku ORDER BY trans_date ROWS BETWEEN 3 PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS predictions_4day_avg
    FROM fire_temp_table
  )
)
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Output Column Types

fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: description
fields.value:
Description: This chart shows the forecasted total sales units for future dates. Forecasting helps in planning inventory and aligning stock levels with anticipated demand.
Insights: Peaks in the forecasted sales signal upcoming demand surges, allowing for better stock planning. Stores or products with high predicted sales should be prioritized for stock allocation, while low-demand periods might be suitable for promotional strategies to boost sales.
fields.title: Description
